TopicTitle: Greetings and Salutations! (From a student and eager space imperialist)

Articles.Content:
Hello, my name is Technetium, but everyone should just call me by Tech. I first got to know about Kerbal Space Program through kurtjmac\'s YouTube videos on his wacky side-adventures into Kerbin orbit and what not (For those who don\'t know, Kurt has taken upon himself the quest to venture to the Farlands in Minecraft 1.7 - a highly arduous journey for Kurt with much in-game trekking to reach the literal end of the world). It also intrigues me that this is a game developed by a fairly new gaming company, based in Mexico, I believe. So that\'s interesting too. Well done to you, Squad!

I am also a senior high school student in San Diego, with responses from college application processes all over, including ones in California (Stanford, UCSD, UCLA, UC Berkeley) and on the U.S. east coast (including Harvard and Princeton, yikes!). I seek to major in international relations or political science.

Aside from that, I am also a TF2 server admin, forum moderator, and Steam group admin for the Weekdayz Community, currently the second largest group on Steam (Although not really a proud status, considering the number of our regulars hardly numbers 2% of our total population of 500,000). No blunt advertisement intended.

My Steam name is [WDZ-SA] Technetium Secretariat, in case anyone is curious.

I look forward to the further development of this game and to Squad\'s future endeavors!

Welcome to the KSP Forums!

Happy Launching!

Arrr!

Admiral Sordid

Welcome to the KSP Forums!

Happy Launching!

Arrr!

Capt\'n Skunky

KSP Community Manager
